title: Tineta 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: Initially, this smells horsey, minty and not entirely clean or clear. A full chunky but clumsy palate is home to dark toasty flavors of clove and spice, while fruit notes are secondary. Barrel-driven mint, spice and clove flavors dominate the finish.

title: Season 2014 Limited Edition Series Carmenère (Southern Oregon)
description: This is a yes/no sort of grape, as far as individual preferences go. If you are a yes, this is a good one. It captures and contains the varietal streak of herb and stem, with ample tart berry fruit to balance.

title: Serra da Estrela 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Lemon and apple aromas are inviting, with a note of sweet grass. A chiseled, acidic yet round palate delivers flavors of tangerine, lime, lees and mild bitterness. This is fresh throughout, but short on the finish.

title: Talosa 2015  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: Ripe dark-skinned berry, French oak, espresso and coconut aromas emerge in the glass. Youthful and taut, the palate doles out Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, truffle and vanilla flavors, set against a frame of tightly knit, refined tannins.

title: Omero 2014 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: This big, chunky, chewy wine brings bold apple fruit front and center. Call it old school, in a good way, and drink it soon for its fresh fruit and lip-smacking highlights of butter, caramel and toasted nuts.

title: One Chain 2015 The Pugilist Cabernet Sauvignon (Langhorne Creek)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon is already approachable. It's full bodied and supple, showing a little lightening at the rim. Cherry, earth and herbal notes take on hints of anise and chocolate on the finish. Drink now–2020.

title: Franklin Tate 2013 Alexanders Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: This plush, full-bodied Cabernet comes across as slightly Shiraz-like, but still represents good value for $15. Smoky, toasty notes of charred oak frame black olive and cola notes, while some red fruit does peek through from time to time. Drink this ready-to-drink Cabernet through 2020.

title: Gancedo 2013 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Foresty berry aromas are warm and chunky. This feels plump and full in body, with grabby tannins and edgy acidity. Salty spicy plum and berry flavors come with loud oak notes, while this finishes full and stout, with toast and mint-like residuals.

title: Grgich Hills 2014 Miljenko's Selection Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This well-structured wine offers flavors of preserved lemon and grilled pineapple, while floral nuttiness and a cheese-like impression give it a hint of funk. It shows some barrel reduction, which blows off as it opens up.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Trois Châteaux Auxerrois (Alsace)
description: Hints of superripe, yellow pear and candied pear make for an enticing nose. The palate is more diffuse but light and fresh. Drink soon while aromas are at their peak.

title: La Togata 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: The nose is shy at first, gradually revealing black-skinned fruit, scorched earth and nutmeg aromas. The juicy, straightforward palate delivers ripe black cherry, mocha and clove flavors through a frame of evolved tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Hewitson 2016 Lu Lu Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)
description: Made in a deliberately moderate-alcohol style, this is a medium-bodied wine with no bells or whistles. Leafy notes hint at fresh greens, while the flavors are more green fig and white grapefruit. Drink now for zesty refreshment.

title: Il Sassolo 2011 Santa Cristina a Mezzana  (Carmignano)
description: This medium-bodied blend of 70% Sangiovese, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot offers mature berry and baking spice aromas. On the palate, round tannins temper the ripe black cherry, vanilla and coffee flavors. Drink through 2018.

title: Innocent Bystander 2016 Moscato Rosé Sparkling (Victoria)
description: This longtime favorite seems to have gotten sweeter over the years, and I think it's about reached its limit, as there's just enough acidity for a semblance of balance. Floral notes of roses and berries burst from the glass, while the flavors feature juicy summer berries and a hint of chocolate.

title: Tenute del Cerro 2012 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Subtle oak, underbrush and leather aromas come together in this tart, astringent red. The palate offers sour cherry, orange zest, toast and sage flavors, framed by raspy tannins.

title: Château Tour Saint-Joseph 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: This soft and generous wine gets its ripe fruity character from its 50% Merlot. There are tannins and a concentrated backbone to the wine. But it is dominated by its generous fruits and fine acidity. This is one of the chateaus owned by negociant Cheval Quancard. Drink from 2019.

title: Clos l'Hermitage 2014  Lalande de Pomerol
description: This small property in Lalande de Pomerol is owned by the Bertin family. In this vintage, they seem to have become excited by wood aging which shows strongly and dominates the Merlot fruits. With spice and bitter chocolate flavors, the wine will take time to soften. Drink from 2022.

title: Coli 2015 Montignana  (Chianti Superiore)
description: This blend of 70% Sangiovese, 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Merlot offers black-skinned berry, underbrush and dried herb aromas. Straightforward and easygoing, the palate doles out ripe black plum, sage and clove flavors, tempered by soft acidity and round tannins. Drink through 2018.

title: Canneto 2015  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: Grilled herb, red berry and sun baked soil aromas come together on the nose of this wine. On the palate, mocha and star anise notes accent a core of tart cherry fruit, while tightly wound tannins provide the framework.

title: Capezzana 2014  Barco Reale di Carmignano
description: This wine opens with delicate black-skinned fruit and a whiff of baking spice. On the palate, black currant and clove flavors are bolstered by firm tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Castro Martin 2015 Family Estate Selection Sobre Lias Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Tropical fruit, melon and fresh carrot aromas lead to a shearing palate with sharp acidity. Quick-hitting, sharp-angled lemony flavors finish tangy, minerally and lasting, with zesty citric acidity creating length. This is lean and pointed at only 12.3% abv.

title: Celestino Pecci 2012 Poggio al Carro  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: Mature plum, new leather, dark spice and forest floor aromas lead the nose, while the robust yet one-dimensional palate offers dried black cherry and licorice flavors veiled in evident alcohol. Bracing tannins grip the finish and need a few more years to unwind.

title: Dei 2015  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: Sun baked earth, pressed blue flower, dark-skinned fruit and grilled herb scents lead the nose. On the palate, a brown spice note accents mature black cherry fruit, supported by easygoing tannins.

title: Château Cap de Mourlin 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Under the same ownership as Balestard la Tonnelle, this is a wine whose tannins and extraction seem to have run away with it. While there is fruit underneath, it seems as though the future for this wine will be firm.

title: Château d'Arcins 2016 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Owned by the Castel family, this estate has made a wine that is packed with fruit and surprisingly soft tannins. The palate is juicy, with a toasty edge and a light, bright black-currant flavor. It is likely to age quickly.

title: Château de Panigon 2014  Médoc
description: The wine comes from a large estate of more than 100 acres. A balanced blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot has given an equally balanced wine. Black-currant fruit, some firm tannins in the background and a juicy aftertaste all give this wine an attractive character that will benefit from some aging. Drink from 2020.

title: Château du Raux 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: This is a spicy toasty wine, showing the wood-aging flavors strongly at this young stage. It has spice, dark tannins and bitter coffee flavors. That suggests the wine could remain firm and with a dry edge. The juicy acidity certainly needs time to fill out. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Fongaban 2013  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This is a rich and full, especially for a wine from the lighter 2013 vintage. Smooth, generous black fruits with a hint of mint (from aging in new wood) are buoyed by dusty tannins and ripe acidity. The wine, made from organic grapes, is fruity, still ready to develop. Drink from 2018.

title: Château d'Hanteillan 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: Situated just north of Saint-Estèphe, the property has produced a generously structured wine that is already balanced. The hints of wood aging sustain the complex, ripe blackberry fruit. Drink from 2020.

title: Château les Anguilleys 2014  Médoc
description: From a vineyard owned by the same family since 1840, this is a delicious fruity wine. It is soft with great swathes of black currant and red-berry fruits. The wine, a blend of half-and-half Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, will develop quickly and easily. Drink from 2018.
